comments:
Eclispe crashed when trying to save a file
JDK 1.4.0 beta 3
version 20011219
win 98, 256 MB RAM, 500 MHz pentium 3

I had noticed that every time I open a new file, the oldest file is closed.  
I had openned quite a number of files without explicitly closing them. 
Sometimes I would come back to a file that I was sure was open, but I would have
to double click on it in order for the editor to open on it.

(look at last log entry)

Log: Thu Jan 10 19:47:36 EST 2002
1 org.eclipse.help 0 Help System shutting down.

This is a UI error.  It ran out of image handles (the last stack trace in the 
log is the relevant one).  Moving to UI.

David, were you just using the "plain" Eclipse workbench, or were there other 
custom plug-ins loaded?  Basically the OS ran out of images, so to debug this 
the following info would be useful:

- what plug-ins you had
- what perspectives and views were open
- how long the workbench had been open
- did you have many other applications open at the same time.
- was it reproducible

I had three perspective windows open: One on debug, and two on different Java
projects.  The workbench had been open for less than a day.  I had just recently
tried running it with JDK 1.4 beta so that I could take advantage of hotswap.
I have only installed one plugin: the Tomcat plugin.  I do not develop plugins
for eclipse yet.

I was debugging a swing appilication earlier in the day: many starts, stops, and
restarts.  However, I closed the app down before openning a new one.  The
debugger showed that after closing each app down, all of the threads were
terminated, so I don't think it should have been able to hold resources.

Unfortunately, (well, fortunately for me) I have not been able to reproduce this.

Other applications open at the time: 
Windows media player
Winzip
Terraterm
mozilla
a firewall
Hummingbird exceed (windows XWindows server)
a local xterm
a dos command prompt (running cygwin)

(see how far I have to go to make windows look like a unix workstation...)

Running out of image handles is a known problem on Win98.
See bug 2078.
The situation has been improved since the bug was filed, but it can still occur 
when using Eclipse for a while on Win98.
You might want to shut down some of the other apps to delay this problem.

However, I doubt this was the cause of your editors getting lost.
There is a workbench preference for reusing editors.
See Workbench / Preferences / Number of opened editors before reusing.
The default is 10.
The least recently used editor is reused when the limit is hit.
You might want to bump this up.

The first stack trace (org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.ResourceException) 
looks like a completely unrelated problem in the Java refactoring support.
I've filed bug 7650 for this.

Closing this PR since the image leak problem is known, and the editor reuse is 
intended behaviour.
